title: What Are Hiragana and Katakana?
subtitle: Generally speaking, hiragana and katakana can be seen as two sets of Japanese alphabets or syllabaries. They do not represent unique meanings as kanji do. They are phonetic letters representing one of the 46 unique syllables.

title: The Similarities Between Hiragana and Katakana
subtitle: Before distinguishing hiragana and katakana, let’s first explore a few of their similarities. First, they represent the same sounds, with each system consisting of 46 characters, one for each syllable.....

title: What’s the difference Between Kana and Romaji?
subtitle: Romaji is the romanization of the Japanese written language. It shows the pronunciation of kana (the general term for these two syllabaries) as well as kanji. When you’re first starting to learn Japanese..
